attributes.title: The Mars Rover, "Curiosity"
attributes.description_short: NASA is sending a robotic rover called "Curiosity" to find out if there is life on Mars.
attributes.description_long: Scientists want to know if methane gas on Mars is a product of biological processes or a result of geologic activity. To find out, NASA is sending a robotic rover called Curiosity to Mars. This video clip from NOVA's program Finding Life Beyond Earth explores the questions that drive the scientists and the implications of possible findings.

attributes.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
attributes.description_short: We are on the verge of answering one of the greatest questions in history: Are we alone?
attributes.description_long: Take a spectacular trip to distant realms of our solar system to discover where secret forms of life may lie hidden. Combining the latest telescope images with dazzling animation, this program immerses audiences in the sights and sounds of alien worlds, while top astrobiologists explain how these places are changing how we think about the potential for life in our solar system.
attributes.funder_message: Funding for NOVA is provided by David H. Koch, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting and PBS viewers. Original funding provided by the David H. Koch Fund for Science, HHMI, the Millicent and Eugene Bell Foundation, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, and PBS Stations.

attributes.description_short: Watch an uncut interview with the late astronaut, conducted at NASA in 1984.

attributes.title: Hunting Planets
attributes.description_short: NASA’s Kepler mission lets us search for planets orbiting stars outside our solar system.
attributes.description_long: NASA’s Kepler mission lets us search for planets orbiting stars outside our solar system.

attributes.title: Early Earth Bombarded By Comets
attributes.description_short: Comets carrying chemicals necessary for life may have come to Earth billions of years ago.
attributes.description_long: Comets carrying chemicals necessary for life may have come to Earth billions of years ago.

attributes.title: Is There Life on Enceladus?
attributes.description_short: Scientists discover evidence for the key ingredients for life on Saturn's moon Enceladus.
attributes.description_long: Scientists discover evidence for the key ingredients for life on Saturn's moon Enceladus.
